Posts.Content: Hi ladies.  I too am suffering with awful aches in my muscles. I am now 17 days post final docetaxel. I am also very very breathless. I mentioned all this at pre chemo 6 review and ended up admitted for 4 nights for suspected pulmonary embolism. I never had one thankfully but was given no explanation for these effects. I am starting to feel really down now as I have no energy to do anything and if I try then am floored with the breathlessness and aching muscles. Anyone know how long I can expect to feel like this??
Posts.Title: Pain in joints and muscles

Posts.Content: Hi both. I had the same op 2 weeks ago. Make sure mum has good pain relief and some laxatives as the pain killers can cause constipation. I purchased a memory foam v pillow from argos which has helped me get comfortable. My friend cooked up lots of meals to freeze for me. Another bought me wipes to make cleaning easier when I feel up to it. Mum needs to just rest up. I am now starting to feel a little better with the right pain relief and I also needed antibiotics as had an infection.  The op itself was fine. Coming home with a drain in was a bit uncomfortable but only for a few days. It doesn't hurt when they take it out. Hope all goes well. Use the sight and all the good people on here will support you all the way x
Posts.Title: Advice please-Mastectomy with lymph node clearance

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your words. I am just struggling with taking it all in. This time last week I was fine, or so I thought. I have an overwhelming need to put things in order so I can concentrate on the fight I face. I know that I am in shock, and not in control of what's happening to me. I am frightened that at my next appointment I will be told it's terminal. I am praying for a chance to fight. I was told to only look at 2 sites online, this one and breast cancer org . Thankyou again for replying because despite huge support I feel so alone.
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Hi Ann Thanks so much for your words. I can only hope for the same outcome. I can deal with surgery and all the treatments if I can come out the other side. I know everyone has been where I am now and it helps to read the threads. My only goals this week are to try and eat, get some sleep and go in there ready to fight. So pleased for you that you are in the needy club! Take care
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much for your reply. Yes it was the UK site that was recommended to me by the Dr. So many people being touched by this dreadful disease but what an amazing network of support. Thanks again.
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: I cannot thank you all enough for your support. It makes it a little easier to not feel alone and see that there is light at the end of the tunnel. I have gone through so many different emotions it's exhausted me. Please keep the comments coming they will go a long way to getting me through this next week and beyond. Bless you all xx
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: I am reading all of these inspiring messages to my kids (24&18) who are in absolute pieces. I cannot begin to thank you people for making me feel a little less terrified. I know that I can rely on the support of everyone and hopefully as my journey progresses I can offer the same to others.
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Hi all I have just been to the breast clinic hoping my lumps were cysts. They weren't. Am devastated. Had 2 core biopsies in breast and a needle in my lymph node too. Read the words multifocul cancer and lots of measurements. Go back for results and plan of action next Thurs. How does everyone cope with the fear? I am terrified. I don't want to die!!! Emotions are all over the place more when I am alone as try to stay strong for the family. The weeks wait is going to be agony. Any support welcome thanks
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Am sorry that you need to go through mastectomy I think that will be what I have to have. The doctor was lovely but seemed unclear on what my scan results indicated. He mentioned lots of scenarios n said to come next week prepared for bad news. So long as it's not worse case scenario I will find the strength but I am so frightened of not having any options.
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Thanks Rhonda. Have just had a bath to try to relax and sleep. Have had a good word with myself. This is my week. My time before everything changes and I am going to try my hardest to put the fears away as much as I can and have some normality. I will never get these days back so I intend to make them count!
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Thankyou all for your supportive comments. Tonight my partner has taken me to Matlock Bath for fish and chips! A good run from where I live but a great distraction. I feel ok at the minute and whatever tomorrow brings I will try to be as strong as possible. Will let you know the outcome guys let's hope it's not too bad x
Posts.Title: One more day to go.

Posts.Content: Hi guys This week seems to be never ending. Got apt tomorrow for the results of my biopsies and will get a confirmed diagnosis and treatment plan I suppose. I don't know how I am getting through this time of fear and uncertainty. My whole outlook on life has changed overnight. Had a real melt down yesterday. Have gone with the attitude that whatever they need to do to save my life then bring it on. I recognise that this is how my brain is coping with the shock but last night I became frightened of facing surgeries and hair loss etc. Currently have some propanalol and diazepam to help. Have been really careful with the diazepam but don't want to sink into a depression cause I need to focus. This site and you wonderful people are helping to get me through these dark hours. Just one more sleep.....
Posts.Title: One more day to go.

Posts.Content: Morning everyone.  Yet another trip to the docs for me today. Got fed up with popping heavy duty pain killers and still being in pain. I now have amytryptiline to try as I believe the majority of the pain is nerve related. Will let you all know if it helps. Am getting very emotional. I am finally seeing my consultant on Wednesday for results following surgery. The fear is creeping in. I suppose it's normal but I am struggling. My daughter off to uni on sat so think that's adding to the emotions.  The plan for next couple of days is distraction. Hope everyone is doing ok on this wet cold Monday xx
Posts.Title: amytryptiline for nerve pain

Posts.Content: Very nice George. ...certainly put a smile on my face! Thanks maggie_may fingers crossed for best possible outcome x
Posts.Title: amytryptiline for nerve pain

Posts.Content: Hi May day.  I have peripheral neuropathy in my toes too. Finished chemo Jan 2016. I was prescribed amytriptiline which does help. 18 months later I still have it but not often now x
Posts.Title: Peripheral neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi May day.  I have peripheral neuropathy in my toes too. Finished chemo Jan 2016. I was prescribed amytriptiline which does help. 18 months later I still have it but not often now x
Posts.Title: Peripheral neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hey JJ great to hear from you. No advice to give as not had recon yet but I am sure that the fresh air and sea water must be beneficial. Good on you xx
Posts.Title: Hi all update JJsailor

Posts.Content: Hi poohbear. I have been taking tamoxifen since May. Like you I was worried about all the side effects. I have not put weight on, I do try to follow a slimming world type eating plan but I was doing that before dx. I do get hot flushes which are manageable and have recently felt a bit achy in my bones.  I would see how you get on, a lot of people are fine and others not. As for hair, mine is growing so thick it's unreal!  I even invested in a pair of thinning scissors for between cuts, and this time last year I was a baldy! Hope tamoxifen is kind to you xxx
Posts.Title: Weight gain with Tamixifen

Posts.Content: Hi George and Jackie I hope you are both well. Yes this time last year I was about ready for chemo number 4!! I am at last getting out the other side and I have to say it's not been an easy ride. I have my recon consultation on Friday and to be honest I just want to get it all over with now. I don't post very often now but read the posts most days. Sharne is doing great. I can't tell you how proud I am of her. She has matured into a wonderful young lady. I know that you guys have helped to guide her through some rough times and I thank you for that. Keep everyone smiling with your quips George!!!  Love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Weight gain with Tamixifen

Posts.Content: Hi mistymoley. Yes they are offering reconstruction but consultant recommended that I wait as likely to have radiotherapy and she said it makes no difference to the result by waiting. I am gonna wait and let them hit me with all they have got first. Have had a good weekend where it hasn't dominated every conversation which is good. Am still trawling through old posts on here getting as much info and perspective as I can.  Still very early days for me and physically I feel exhausted. Don't know if its coincidence, tied in with the cancer  or what but feel like I could sleep for a week. Again thanks for flies guys x
Posts.Title: It's confirmed.....cancer

Posts.Content: So, I went for my results and they told me that I have multi focal cancer which is lobular??? and hormone receptive. It is in both areas of biopsy and the lymph nodes. Plan is mastectomy on 13 August and then 3 weeks later they will be able to grade it n see if it's spread. Is this normal?  I thought they would have all the information today? Feel strangely calm at the thought of losing my breast. I will take being alive all day long. Don't think it has sunk in yet.
Posts.Title: It's confirmed.....cancer

Posts.Content: Well having slept on it I still feel strangely calm. Practical mode has kicked in. Need to get bits n bobs sorted so I can recover after surgery without worrying about stuff. The train has left the station and I am on it, destination unknown. I need to organise getting measured properly for bras and maybe that will be a bit weird. Thanks for your continued support guys x
Posts.Title: It's confirmed.....cancer

Posts.Content: Lol fiddlesticks!!! I can absolutely get where you are coming from. I finished chemo end of Jan n now have a good covering but I look like someone out of Grease! I have to use gel as it's so thick and wavy but growing in all directions. My hair was never like this before, I would have paid good money for it.....30 years ago in the days of the perm!
Posts.Title: Amused by my hair

Posts.Content: Lol fiddlesticks!!! I can absolutely get where you are coming from. I finished chemo end of Jan n now have a good covering but I look like someone out of Grease! I have to use gel as it's so thick and wavy but growing in all directions. My hair was never like this before, I would have paid good money for it.....30 years ago in the days of the perm!
Posts.Title: Amused by my hair

Posts.Content: Best wishes Pat.  Let us all know how your doing when you feel up to it.  Big hugs xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy tomorrow, 9-9-15

Posts.Content: Hello ClaireLou B So sorry that you have found yourself joining our exclusive club. You will go through lots of emotions over the coming months. It's normal, and we all know how you feel. Use this site to help you through, there are so many people on here all ready to give you support in what ever way you need it. I had a mastectomy last year as well as lymph node clearance. I had 4 tumours, the largest being 50 mm. Chemo followed and then radiotherapy. Once you know your treatment plan, things wont seem so frightening. The waiting in the early stages for various results and info was for me the worst time. Try not to google, if you want to know anything just ask away on here. Sending you a big hug xx
Posts.Title: Coping With the Waiting !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Morning. I am in the process of claiming on my critical illness. My cancer invasive lobular multifocul. I am hoping it will be straight forward but am not counting my chickens yet. Will let you know how it goes x
Posts.Title: critical illness insurance

Posts.Content: Hi. I also had fec-t. My fingernails became very sensitive and painful but thankfully I haven't lost any. I also seem to be growing ridges on them now but still all intact. Chemo finished end of January so I am hoping they stay put. I never used any nail polish but wore gloves for any washing up or cleaning jobs. Good luck Gina x
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: What a nice post JJ  Have a lovely time at the wedding you deserve it!  The worst is over now so build your strength up ready for the op and make sure you get a tipple or two down your throat today!!!!
Posts.Title: Something good for a change

Posts.Content: Hi. I also had fec-t. My fingernails became very sensitive and painful but thankfully I haven't lost any. I also seem to be growing ridges on them now but still all intact. Chemo finished end of January so I am hoping they stay put. I never used any nail polish but wore gloves for any washing up or cleaning jobs. Good luck Gina x
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi all. Well, no wonder I have been in so much pain! Went to the seroma clinic yesterday and had it drained. This doesn't hurt at all for anyone worrying about having it done. My wound is infected despite being on antibiotics, had a reaction to the steri strips and also have cording. This explains the pain and discomfort. I have to go back on Friday as by then this course of tablets will be finished and I may need another course.  When I started to massage the cording the tears finally flowed. I felt really sad and sorry for myself and wondered why it's not enough to go through the surgery? All these extras are what I didn't prepare for.  Felt better after a good cry and a large dose of self pity. Today I will plod along knowing why I feel so sore and will stop trying to hurry up the recovery. Keep smiling guys xx
Posts.Title: Seroma and infection.

Posts.Content: Hi Siggers yes it was Sept we started out on the chemo. I have my rads planning next week and picc line out. I am assuming 15 sessions will start the week after. I too have an appointment in September to start the reconstruction journey and then this will finally be done apart from the tamoxifen.  Somebody asked about T. Mine always ran for an hour followed by a 5 minute saline flush.  Am still weary in body and that is getting me down. I think I was that pleased that the final chemo was done that I was forgetting it now needs to do its thing around my body I am feeling tingly around the fingers and toes. So far all still there but as I had almost every side effect at one time or another I doubt I will escape this one. I never chose to be part of this elite group but I am proud to be one of you. Whenever I have felt alone and frightened I have come on here and instantly got whatever support I have needed. I hope I have been able to give a bit back and I shall continue to do so xxx
Posts.Title: Chemo done!

Posts.Content: Well I did it. Survived fec-t and all it threw at me. I am left looking very different to when it started... Bald fat n a front tooth missing. Yes tooth!  I hadn't read about effects on the teeth but apparently it happens. Can't risk the dentist for a couple of weeks so I have to put up with looking like a candidate for the Jeremy Kyle show. The weight gain has really got to me. I just want to find some energy now to get my body moving again. Am day 9 last T. Can't walk up the stairs without feeling breathless and exhausted at the minute.  I have my rads planning meeting next week. The final stage before reconstruction. I get to go on Tamoxifen too. Oh the joys.  I am now very positive in my head.  It's nearly over. I did it. I am a little scathed and certainly not the same person I was pre BC. I have learned who I can rely on and who I can't.  I think it is hard for people to understand how we feel if they haven't walked the walk. That's why these forums are so important. Ramble over xx
Posts.Title: Chemo done!

Posts.Content: Hi Jj I totally get where you are coming from. I somehow got through all the treatment and the joys that went with it.  I have started back on a phased return to work, and have never felt so low. My anxiety has returned big time too. Everyone says how well I look, how my ridiculous hair suits me. They can't see what's going on inside. The racing heart, the emotions never far away.  I am finally allowing myself to actually think about what has happened to me and it's horrible.  I have self referred through work for some counselling. I recognise that I need to deal with it. The Dr has given me beta blockers for the anxiety.  How we are feeling is normal. I have read so many accounts of others feeling the same. We are changed, inside and out. But we did it. We got through it,  and we will get through this too. Lots of hugs to you xxx
Posts.Title: Falling apart now it's over

Posts.Content: Well everyone is saying how well I am coping. On the outside I seem very together, positive and strong. If only they saw what was on the inside. 3 more weeks till the mastectomy. Initially I refused to be concerned about how I will look. Well its creeping in now with a vengeance. The question of lymph nodes having it in, has it spread??? My heart is constantly racing despite propanolol. I can't stay still, can't relax. Sleep??? Yeah right that's not good either. Am so so lucky in how much support I have. I can't let them know how terrified I really am. Major meltdown going on. I seem to get them every 2 or 3 days. Am keeping busy but then its just me and my thoughts. The waiting is a nightmare in itself. Needed to put this down. Feeling majorly sorry for myself right now x
Posts.Title: Struggling on the inside

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for the support. You all know where I am coming from and your words somehow calm me. I do have a couple of friends who I can talk to honestly so maybe it's time I did. I just feel so out of control and I am the type of person who needs to have some control if that makes sense? I know that things will speed up soon and what feels like an eternity will pass. The hardest thing for me at the moment is watching my daughter trying to be so brave. It's her birthday next week she will be 19. So want her to enjoy it and have some time away from all this. I feel a bit better today and that's largely down to the support of you guys so I thank you muchly xx
Posts.Title: Struggling on the inside

Posts.Content: Fifi I am not having immediate reconstruction as the surgeon suggested I wait as radiotherapy is highly likely and she said it would be better to get the treatment and heal first. I was and am ok with that and I  too have a fantastic partner who wants me to have a life rather than a boob. I guess once it all sunk in the reality came through. Little things like having to get different tops and stuff. I know that it will all be worth it to have my life and health. I already feel like a different person. Am not frightened of the op itself....yet.  I think I try to stay strong because I worry that people will get sick of hearing about it. I am a talker and it's how I deal with things. That's what's so helpful about this site cause I can come on here and let it out.  Wishing all you good people well x
Posts.Title: Struggling on the inside
